message.content:
as configuracoes visuais nao esta igual ao repositorio que clonamos # ~/.tmux.conf

# Options to make tmux more pleasant
set -g mouse on
set -g default-terminal "tmux-256color"

# Configure the catppuccin plugin
set -g @catppuccin_flavor "mocha"
set -g @catppuccin_window_status_style "rounded"

# Load catppuccin
run ~/.config/tmux/plugins/catppuccin/tmux/catppuccin.tmux
# For TPM, instead use `run ~/.tmux/plugins/tmux/catppuccin.tmux`

# Make the status line pretty and add some modules
set -g status-right-length 100
set -g status-left-length 100
set -g status-left ""
set -g status-right "#{E:@catppuccin_status_application}"
set -agF status-right "#{E:@catppuccin_status_cpu}"
set -ag status-right "#{E:@catppuccin_status_session}"
set -ag status-right "#{E:@catppuccin_status_uptime}"
set -agF status-right "#{E:@catppuccin_status_battery}"

run ~/.config/tmux/plugins/tmux-plugins/tmux-cpu/cpu.tmux
run ~/.config/tmux/plugins/tmux-plugins/tmux-battery/battery.tmux
# Or, if using TPM, just run TPM

content.thinking:
The user is saying that the visual configurations are not the same as the repository they cloned. They've shown me their `~/.tmux.conf` file which uses the Catppuccin theme and several tmux plugins.

Let me analyze what they have:
1. Catppuccin theme plugin
2. tmux-cpu plugin (for CPU status)
3. tmux-battery plugin (for battery status)

They say the visuals don't match what's in the repository. I should help them troubleshoot this. Let me:
1. First, check if the plugins are installed correctly
2. Check the tmux configuration
3. See what might be missing or misconfigured

Let me check the plugin paths and see if everything is properly installed.

content.thinking:
The plugins are installed. Now I can see the issue - the user's config references `tmux-cpu` and `tmux-battery` plugins from `~/.config/tmux/plugins/tmux-plugins/`, but those don't seem to be there. Let me check what plugins exist and what might be missing.

Also, I notice that the `status-right` in the tmux options shows:
```
status-right "#{E:@catppuccin_status_application} #[fg=#cba6f7]%d-%m-%Y %H:%M "
```

But the config file has:
```
set -g status-right "#{E:@catppuccin_status_application}"
set -agF status-right "#{E:@catppuccin_status_cpu}"
set -agF status-right "#{E:@catppuccin_status_session}"
set -agF status-right "#{E:@catppuccin_status_uptime}"
set -agF status-right "#{E:@catppuccin_status_battery}"
```

So the status-right doesn't include the cpu, session, uptime, and battery modules. This is because those plugins (tmux-cpu and tmux-battery) might not be installed or loaded correctly.

Let me check if the plugins exist.

content.thinking:
Now I understand the issue. The user's config file is pointing to the wrong path:

In the config:
```
run ~/.config/tmux/plugins/tmux-plugins/tmux-cpu/cpu.tmux
run ~/.config/tmux/plugins/tmux-plugins/tmux-battery/battery.tmux
```

But the actual plugins are installed in:
```
~/.tmux/plugins/tmux-cpu
~/.tmux/plugins/tmux-battery (missing!)
```

So the issues are:
1. The paths in the config file are wrong - they should point to `~/.tmux/plugins/` instead of `~/.config/tmux/plugins/tmux-plugins/`
2. The `tmux-battery` plugin is not installed

Let me check if the uptime module is also missing and then fix the config file paths.

So `tmux-cpu` is installed in `~/.tmux/plugins/`, but `tmux-battery` is not. Let me:

1. Fix the config paths to point to the correct location
2. Install the missing `tmux-battery` plugin

The user's config has these lines:
```

run ~/.config/tmux/plugins/tmux-plugins/tmux-battery/battery.tmux
```

They should be:
```
run ~/.tmux/plugins/tmux-cpu/cpu.tmux
run ~/.tmux/plugins/tmux-battery/battery.tmux
```

Let me also check if there's a separate uptime plugin or if it's part of another plugin.

1. **Caminhos incorretos**: O config aponta para `~/.config/tmux/plugins/tmux-plugins/`, mas os plugins estÃ£o em `~/.tmux/plugins/`

# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
# ğŸªŸ Tmux Configuration - Catppuccin Mocha Theme
# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
# ğŸ”§ Basic Settings
# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

# Increase scrollback buffer size
set -g history-limit 50000

# Enable focus events
set -g focus-events on

# Super useful when using "grouped sessions" and multi-monitor setup
set-window-option -g aggressive-resize on

# Set default shell
set-option -g default-shell /usr/bin/zsh
set-option -g default-command /usr/bin/zsh

# Enable true color
set -g default-terminal "tmux-256color"
set -ga terminal-overrides ",*256col*:Tc"
set -ga terminal-overrides '*:Ss=\E[%p1%dTc:Se=\E[2Tc'

# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
# âŒ¨ï¸ Keybindings
# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

# Set prefix to Ctrl-a (like GNU screen)
unbind C-b
set-option -g prefix C-a
bind-key C-a send-prefix

# Reload configuration
bind r source-file ~/.tmux.conf \; display "Config reloaded!"

# Split panes using | and -
bind | split-window -h -c "#{pane_current_path}"
bind - split-window -v -c "#{pane_current_path}"
unbind '"'
unbind %

# Create new window in current path
bind c new-window -c "#{pane_current_path}"

# Navigate panes using vim-like keys
bind h select-pane -L
bind j select-pane -D
bind k select-pane -U
bind l select-pane -R

# Navigate windows
bind -r C-h previous-window
bind -r C-l next-window

# Resize panes
bind -r H resize-pane -L 5
bind -r J resize-pane -D 5
bind -r K resize-pane -U 5
bind -r L resize-pane -R 5

# Copy mode vi-style
setw -g mode-keys vi
bind -T copy-mode-vi v send -X begin-selection
bind -T copy-mode-vi y send-keys -X copy-pipe-and-cancel "xclip -in -selection clipboard"
bind P paste-buffer

# Mouse support
set -g mouse on

# ğŸ”§ Basic Settings
# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

# Increase scrollback buffer size
set -g history-limit 50000

# Enable focus events
set -g focus-events on

# Super useful when using "grouped sessions" and multi-monitor setup
set-window-option -g aggressive-resize on

# Set default shell
set-option -g default-shell /usr/bin/zsh
set-option -g default-command /usr/bin/zsh

# Enable true color
set -g default-terminal "tmux-256color"
set -ga terminal-overrides ",*256col*:Tc"
set -ga terminal-overrides '*:Ss=\E[%p1%dTc:Se=\E[2Tc'

# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
# âŒ¨ï¸ Keybindings
# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

# Set prefix to Ctrl-a (like GNU screen)
unbind C-b
set-option -g prefix C-a
bind-key C-a send-prefix

# Reload configuration
bind r source-file ~/.tmux.conf \; display "Config reloaded!"

# Split panes using | and -
bind | split-window -h -c "#{pane_current_path}"
bind - split-window -v -c "#{pane_current_path}"
unbind '"'
unbind %

# Create new window in current path
bind c new-window -c "#{pane_current_path}"

# Navigate panes using vim-like keys
bind h select-pane -L
bind j select-pane -D
bind k select-pane -U
bind l select-pane -R

# Navigate windows
bind -r C-h previous-window
bind -r C-l next-window

# Resize panes
bind -r H resize-pane -L 5
bind -r J resize-pane -D 5
bind -r K resize-pane -U 5
bind -r L resize-pane -R 5

# Copy mode vi-style
setw -g mode-keys vi
bind -T copy-mode-vi v send -X begin-selection
bind -T copy-mode-vi y send-keys -X copy-pipe-and-cancel "xclip -in -selection clipboard"
bind P paste-buffer

# Mouse support
set -g mouse on

# ğŸªŸ Tmux Configuration - Catppuccin Mocha Theme
# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
# ğŸ”§ Basic Settings
# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

# Increase scrollback buffer size
set -g history-limit 50000

# Enable focus events
set -g focus-events on

# Super useful when using "grouped sessions" and multi-monitor setup
set-window-option -g aggressive-resize on

# Set default shell
set-option -g default-shell /usr/bin/zsh
set-option -g default-command /usr/bin/zsh

# Enable true color
set -g default-terminal "tmux-256color"
set -ga terminal-overrides ",*256col*:Tc"
set -ga terminal-overrides '*:Ss=\E[%p1%dTc:Se=\E[2Tc'

# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
# âŒ¨ï¸ Keybindings
# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

# Set prefix to Ctrl-a (like GNU screen)
unbind C-b
set-option -g prefix C-a
bind-key C-a send-prefix

# Reload configuration
bind r source-file ~/.tmux.conf \; display "Config reloaded!"

# Split panes using | and -
bind | split-window -h -c "#{pane_current_path}"
bind - split-window -v -c "#{pane_current_path}"
unbind '"'
unbind %

# Create new window in current path
bind c new-window -c "#{pane_current_path}"

# Navigate panes using vim-like keys
bind h select-pane -L
bind j select-pane -D
bind k select-pane -U
bind l select-pane -R

# Navigate windows
bind -r C-h previous-window
bind -r C-l next-window

# Resize panes
bind -r H resize-pane -L 5
bind -r J resize-pane -D 5
bind -r K resize-pane -U 5
bind -r L resize-pane -R 5

# Copy mode vi-style
setw -g mode-keys vi
bind -T copy-mode-vi v send -X begin-selection
bind -T copy-mode-vi y send-keys -X copy-pipe-and-cancel "xclip -in -selection clipboard"
bind P paste-buffer

# Mouse support
set -g mouse on

# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
# ğŸªŸ Window & Pane Settings
# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

# Start window and pane numbering at 1
set -g base-index 1
setw -g pane-base-index 1

# Renumber windows when one is closed
set -g renumber-windows on

# Automatically rename windows
setw -g automatic-rename on

# Don't rename window automatically when running commands
setw -g allow-rename off

# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
# ğŸ¨ Catppuccin Theme Settings
# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

# Catppuccin flavor
set -g @catppuccin_flavour 'mocha'
set -g @catppuccin_window_status_style "rounded"

# Status bar position (top)
set -g status-position top

# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
# ğŸ”Œ TPM (Tmux Plugin Manager)
# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

# List of plugins
set -g @plugin 'tmux-plugins/tpm'
set -g @plugin 'tmux-plugins/tmux-sensible'
set -g @plugin 'tmux-plugins/tmux-resurrect'
set -g @plugin 'tmux-plugins/tmux-continuum'
set -g @plugin 'tmux-plugins/tmux-yank'
set -g @plugin 'tmux-plugins/tmux-cpu'

# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
# ğŸ¯ Plugin Settings
# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

# tmux-resurrect settings
set -g @resurrect-capture-pane-contents 'on'
set -g @resurrect-strategy-nvim 'session'
set -g @resurrect-save-shell-history 'on'

# tmux-continuum settings
set -g @continuum-restore 'on'
set -g @continuum-save-interval '15'
set -g @continuum-boot 'on'
set -g @continuum-boot-options 'iterm'

# tmux-yank settings
set -g @yank_selection_mouse 'clipboard'
set -g @yank_action 'copy-pipe-no-clear'

# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
# ğŸ¨ Load Catppuccin Theme (manual method - recommended)
# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

run ~/.config/tmux/plugins/catppuccin/tmux/catppuccin.tmux

# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
# ğŸ“Š Status Bar Modules
# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

# Load additional status modules
run ~/.tmux/plugins/tmux-cpu/cpu.tmux
run ~/.tmux/plugins/tmux-battery/battery.tmux

# Configure status line with modules
set -g status-right-length 150
set -g status-left-length 100
set -g status-left ""
set -g status-right "#{E:@catppuccin_status_application}"
set -agF status-right "#{E:@catppuccin_status_cpu}"
set -agF status-right "#{E:@catppuccin_status_session}"
set -agF status-right "#{E:@catppuccin_status_uptime}"
set -agF status-right "#{E:@catppuccin_status_battery}"

# â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

run '~/.tmux/plugins/tpm/tpm'
